content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-094-02-B
|Item_parent=Rachialgia
|Item_parent_short=Rachialgia
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the prevalence of spinal pain: neck pain, back pain, low back pain
|Description=Spinal pain: neck pain, back pain, low back pain
|Rubric=Epidemiology
|Contributors=Bisseriex Hélène,Nguyen Christelle
|Order=2}}

Cervicalgia: 2/3 of the population affected in their lifetime. Prevalence between 2 and 11%.

Dorsalgia: rarer, 5 to 10% of rheumatology consultations.

'''Common low back pain''' ''':''''

- Prevalence = 1/4 to 1/3 of the general population. Incidence: 60 to 90%.

- Most frequent musculoskeletal disorder

- Most disabling condition in the world (number of days in pain, disability or time off work) '''[[Disability status SDD-345|(disability status)]]''''

→ Major cost to society (chronic forms 10% = 80% of costs)

question.title: Prevalence of spinal pain
question.description: Spinal pain: neck pain, back pain, low back pain

option_a.title: 2/3 of the population affected in their lifetime
option_a.description: Cervicalgia: 2/3 of the population affected in their lifetime

option_c.title: 5 to 10% of rheumatology consultations
option_c.description: Dorsalgia: rarer, 5 to 10% of rheumatology consultations

option_d.title: 1/4 to 1/3 of the general population
option_d.description: Prevalence = 1/4 to 1/3 of the general population

correct_option.title: 2/3 of the population affected in their lifetime
correct_option.description: Cervicalgia: 2/3 of the population affected in their lifetime
